timeline.message:
[MOB-1876] - Consume a message after click/back

If a message is consume type, remove the message only after click events on in-app OR if pressed BACK_BUTTON.

timeline.bodyText: Hmm at this point I think we should have a common method for handling both normal clicks and back click, since the handling for both is the same.
timeline.author: vbabenkoru

timeline.bodyText: I think doing setConsumed changes the semantics of what 'consumed' means. Previously it was an indicator that we've sent a consume API call to the server. Now it's not very clear what it means.
timeline.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText: Should I introduce new variable - markForRemoval? in inAppMessage?
replies.author: Ayyanchira

timeline.bodyText: I think this will track a delete event, unlike the previous code that was calling removeMessage with just one parameter. Is there a reason to use another version of removeMessage here?
timeline.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText:
I think we introduced DeleteActionType.Other for this purposes. Also thought it would be better to pass location if we know the context of where the inapp was being displayed.
May be we can discuss this in future. Reverting back to using removeMessage with single parameter
replies.author: Ayyanchira
